If you have a stack trace or any logs, please format them using github's triple-backquote notation, or if they are large you may also consider attaching them as a file or gist.* ### Please select a label *Of the labels displayed on the right, change the label that starts with 'in:' to an appropriate one. Otherwise you may remove this section.*

bug.title: Change ID3 album scan specifications
bug.body: The Sonic server summarizes the album as it scans. However, there is no test case. Add test cases to prevent degrate.

bug.title: Only the query of the specific pattern is skipped in UPnP search
bug.body: When is searched for the title of the song class, artist is also included in the condition. Or add ``that option``.

bug.title: NPE avoidance in health checks
bug.body: Opening health check of snapshot before scan will cause NPE, please fix.

bug.title: Cleanup during scanning
bug.body: Shouldn't do any cleanup during the scan, but the legacy probably didn't consider. Since the addition of Lucene is added to the cleanup, the exclusive design needs to be reviewed. If this operation is performed, the index cannot be written. It is not serious because it will return if you restart. However, since the user cannot visually judge, a phenomenon that occurs after falling into an inappropriate lock state may be reported as a secondary failure. If it can be reproduced on the airsonic side, the airsonic side also needs to be modified.

bug.title: Missing case of sort test
bug.body: Insufficient testing when the name is (full-width / half-width) alphabet and reading is Japanese. This is a relatively uncommon use case, but may be necessary when using voice input. - Some sorts do not sort correctly - Sorting cannot be correctly performed in a sort implementation that depends only on Colator instead of Comparator The following actions are required: - Adding test data - Modify existing logic - Consider design change of Index generation

bug.title: Some DLNA items are not available
bug.body: Inappropriate class loading order causes problems in certain environments. #### v106.1.0 - Startup failure in case of Tomcat - Jetty has no problems #### v106.1.1 - Temporary fix to remove Tomcat startup failure - There is a case where NullPointer occurs in the processor that depends on MediaFileUpnpProcessor Fix to work correctly with Tomcat and Jetty. This obstruction is a blocking item on the following topics: #366 #363 #362

bug.title: Avoid degrate of startup flow
bug.body: A degrate occurs at 106.0.0. Media Scanner Service bug. Legacy's startup flow is originally partially fazy implemented. (But at least it was working) There is an implicit specification in the server startup flow. The major rules for scanning are as follows : - Database initialization occurs first - Scan start must be after database initialization - Scan must not start during database initialization as a result of scheduler startup Airsonic 10.5.0 included a process to change the flow. As a result, scans can be performed in parallel independently of the database initialization thread. This can cause problems during initial startup when certain conditions are met. (When the library already exists in the default music folder, and the first time start or update the server etc.) If a failure occurs, the scan will not be performed correctly. The range of influence of this obstacle is wide. #### Short-term response - Delete scan kick of the scheduler post-process. - This disables the first scan. The user must log in and take a scan kick. Still, it's trivial compared to the negative consequences of disability. - A short-term response is not a provisional response, but a part of what should be done finally. #### Medium to long-term response - The first scan kick should be done in the right place. - In essence, there is a design problem that the first scan kick is a scheduler post process. It is an design error that the timing of the first scan is not the completion of DB initialization, but is left to MediaScannerService generation timing. Forcing a first scan without understanding them is also a design error. - A control implementation is required to ensure that the first scan is kicked after DB initialization. -> Or observe Airsonic's solutions

bug.title: Defects when lucene-misc was introduced
bug.body: 8ddd6e8 After installing misc, some search UTs do not work properly on Windows. (There is no problem during running server.)

bug.title: Theme switching failed
bug.body: ed5580e Modify so that other themes are not affected.

bug.title: Music folder search before initial startup
bug.body: Among the Dao modifications made in #310, there is a method that does not assume the case where MusicFolder does not exist. Confirmation and correction are required.

bug.title: Only a small part of the data is not correctly aligned
bug.body: Most sorts are correct, but only a small part of the data may not line up correctly in ID3. (A specific string pattern?) T-SQUARE LIVE FAREWELL & WELCOME [Disc 2] T-SQUARE LIVE FAREWELL & WELCOME [Disc 1] MOMENT [Disc 2] MOMENT [Disc 1]

bug.title: Fix image URL generation logic for DLNA
bug.body: Id3 image is incorrect. Modify so that DLNA image processing is performed correctly.

container_name: jpsonic environment: JAVA_OPTS: '-Duser.timezone=Asia/Tokyo -DDatabaseMysqlMaxlength=512 -DDatabaseConfigType=EMBED -DDatabaseConfigEmbedDriver=org.postgresql.Driver -DDatabaseConfigEmbedPassword=jpsonic -DDatabaseConfigEmbedUrl=jdbc:postgresql://db:5432/jpsonic?stringtype=unspecified -DDatabaseConfigEmbedUsername=jpsonic -DDatabaseUsertableQuote=\"' ports: - "4040:4040" ulimits: nofile: soft: "12280" hard: "12280" volumes: - /opt/jpsonic/data:/jpsonic/data:Z - /opt/jpsonic/playlists:/jpsonic/playlists:Z - /opt/jpsonic/podcasts:/jpsonic/podcasts:Z - /data/music:/jpsonic/music:z networks: - external_network - internal_network depends_on: - db restart: always db: image: postgres:9.5-alpine environment: POSTGRES_USER: jpsonic POSTGRES_PASSWORD: jpsonic POSTGRES_DB: jpsonic ports: - "5432:5432" healthcheck: test: ["CMD", "pg_isready", "-U", "postgres"] volumes: - /opt/jpsonic/postgres:/var/lib/postgresql/data networks: - internal_network restart: always networks: external_network: internal_network: internal: true ``` 2. using in normally 3. change docker image tag number from 105.1.0 to 105.2.0 in docker-compose.yml 4. `docker-compose up -d` 5. error produced ## System information * **Jpsonic version**: v105.2.0 * **Operating system**: host OS: Fedora 30 * **Operating system**: guest OS base image: alpine 3.9 * Deails of my jpsonic docker image for more information https://github.com/orumin/jpsonic/blob/master/Dockerfile * **Java version**: OpenJDK 8.222.10-r0 * **Proxy server**: Nginx 1.17 * **Client**: Vivaldi latest stable * **Language**: Japanese ## Additional notes *Include any extra notes here. Otherwise you may remove this section.*

bug.title: RecentAlbum displays differently on Web/DLNA
bug.body: #305 RecentAlbum display may be different between Web and DLNA. (It's not completely different, it's a little different.) There's no big difference in the code and I don't know why.

bug.title: Migration test
bug.body: - [x] Checking the index and DB version - [x] Delete old index - [x] The path sorting has been modified. Check if there is any problem migrating from old scanned data - [x] ~~Rethink sorting options. If the speed improvement benefit from the strict sorting option is small, the setting item on the screen side is omitted at this stage. If the scope of speed measures expands in the future, it will be revived.~~ - [x] Get help on sort options

bug.title: Improve left index
bug.body: - [x] In snapshot, there is a degrate that does not reflect tag reading. Please correct. - [x] Change title for hovering from name to reading . To make it easier for users to check. - [x] Please support serial number sort if possible.

bug.title: Genre search after scanning
bug.body: Genre scan does not work properly after scanning on the web screen. Fix the reader as it may not update correctly. ___ This may be due to the slow writing of the index. (If time is taken, it may be reflected correctly. Verification is required.)

bug.title: About the matter which can not be scanned
bug.body: Report from user. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27724847/61270098-96220880-a7db-11e9-9ead-a0815a69762a.png) Sort update processing. If the prerequisite scanning completes successfully, no errors occur. #### Correspondence Added workaround code and error message. This message is essentially unreachable code. If this is displayed, the environment may not meet the prerequisites. Make an announcement and watch the progress.

bug.title: Update of album Id3 is incorrect
bug.body: The treatment of the album FirstChild is not correct. Among the properties of AlbumId3 to be updated by artistSort in the replacement process, there were cases in which the property determined by the value of child was overwritten with a value other than FirstChild. Change to update only artistSort when updating artistSort. Resolved in #249.

bug.title: Index generation change is not working
bug.body: The generation change of DB schema definition is fully functional. The lucene index generation alternation logic exists in MediaScannerService but it seems to be nonfunctional. (Probably not working with Airsonic too?) Rewrite if necessary. ___ Legacy is managing by schema version. lucene has experienced that the implementation difference by version is very large. Therefore, the management version should be clarified with index implememt version + schema version.

bug.title: Random search duplication
bug.body: Duplicate occurs during random search. Fix to 101.0.1 and 100.1.1.

bug.title: Double registration of Document
bug.body: Docment double registration occurs when creating search index. Fix to 101.0.1 and 100.1.1.

bug.title: DNLA can not be used
bug.body: Occurs at SNAPSHOT. Need investigation. ____ 0d78c30 last safety point 143a220 Many library updates at the same time. DWR Failure point #192 8a1f36c DWR fix point f04ec61 current ____ Problems occur in all revisions after 143a220. DNLA starts without error but can not search from the client

bug.title: can not specify year
bug.body: ## Problem description Search by year is not available. ### Steps to reproduce Include Year in the search criteria. ## Additional notes The new version of lucene does not allow you to specify a range null. When replacing legacy code, it was not corrected to use with MAX or MIN of int. This issue is also closed when #161 is closed because it has already been addressed in #161.

bug.title: Unable to search MusicFolder
bug.body: ## Problem description MusicFolder specification may malfunction depending on the name of MusicFolder. ### Steps to reproduce - Specify a directory name not divided by ClassicTokenizer but divided by UAX#29 in MusicFolder. ## Additional notes - Implementation method for issuing a multi query are slightly different from lucene 3.x and 7.x. Need proper field type and parser. There is a defect in this point. - If there is a defect in the parser, there is cases where a problem occurs in 7.x. - There is no test case that can cover these.

bug.title: Argument specification is not correctly recognized
bug.body: Jpsonic specific problem. In org.airsonic.player.util.Util, external arguments are handled incorrectly.

bug.title: Can not perform RandomSearch
bug.body: Random search can not be done with REST. Mediatype index does not work because of capital / lower case mismatch at registration.
